item.title: by: Mariya
item.description: Hey Will, that's really fucking hilarious - we're here in France gettin' paid to do the same effin' thing, but without the singing and dancing, or any cute Asian kids. Bill and I are 'assistants' of English at two different high schools and just like you we have no materials whatsoever to go on. We just have to invent lessons to fill up 12 classes a week and pretend we know how to speak the language. Anyway, it's funny to read about your experiences, cause we sure as hell have been there. Making an insignificant bit of nonsense serve as a subject for a 50 minute class is now my forté and Bill can gesture and gesticulate his way out of any jam. I have some worksheets I can totally forward you if you're interested, they're on stuff like stereotypes, thanksgiving, the melting pot, Nancy Pelosi, the blues, slang, some more slang, Friends the TV show, and other random shit. All of that will leave your students blank-faced and kinda like zombies, in my experience. We've had to improvise under the scrutinizing all-seeing eye of the snooty French beaurocracy and so far we're ok. Much luck, keep posting stories, and check out my blogitty-blog @ www.fig-from-thistle.blogspot.com
